message.content:
cs.GR, cs.HC, cs.NI, cs.SD, cs.DC. 

The paper discusses the challenges of maintaining a consistent view of a shared state in networked virtual environments, which is a common topic in computer graphics (cs.GR) and human-computer interaction (cs.HC). The authors propose an adaptive synchronization algorithm, which involves network communication and distributed systems, suggesting the paper may also fit into the categories of networked systems (cs.NI) and software engineering (cs.SD). Finally, the paper discusses the use of electronic motion sensors and haptic devices, which could potentially fall under the category of distributed computing (cs.DC).
